search.errorMessage: SubjectId or nationalId is required and should be in the right format. NationalId must 10 numeric characters

formControls.title: Create a new Admin User
formControls.help: Add user for the Admin UI by filling out the form.

nationalId.label: National Id (Kennitala)
nationalId.helpText: The nationalId (Kennitala) of the Admin User

email.label: User email
email.helpText: The email of the admin user
email.errorMessage: Email is required and needs to be in a right format

scope.label: Scope
scope.helpText: Select the appropriate Scope for this Admin User
scope.errorMessage: Select the appropriate Scope for this Admin User

active.label: Active
active.helpText: Sets if user is active or not

formControls.title: Create a new Grant Type
formControls.help: Add or edit a Grant Type

name.label: Name
name.helpText: The unique name of the Grant Type
name.errorMessage: Name is required and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.errorMessage: Description is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Create a new Idp Provider
formControls.help: Add or edit a IDP Provider

name.label: Name
name.helpText: The unique name of the provider with no spaces or symbols
name.errorMessage: Name is required and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.helpText: Short description about this Identity Provider. This will be used as an label in the IDP Restriction form
description.errorMessage: Description is required and needs to be in the right format

helptext.label: Help Text
helptext.placeholder: Add this provider to be able to connect with an App from Example Firm
helptext.helpText: This text will be shown in the form where users to the Admin UI select this Identity Provider
helptext.errorMessage: Help text is required and needs to be in the right format

level.label: Level
level.helpText: The security level of this Identity Provider. Between 1 and 4. 4 meaning that this provider provides the highest security and 1 if this provider provides low security
level.errorMessage: Level is required and needs to be a number from 1-4

formControls.title: Edit Language
formControls.help: Add new language by filling out the form

isoKey.label: ISO 639-1 key
isoKey.helpText: The iso key (identifier)  for this language

description.label: Language name
description.helpText: The language name in it's own language
description.errorMessage: Language name is required and needs to be in the right format

englishDescription.label: Language name in English
englishDescription.errorMessage: Language name in English is required and needs to be in the right format

level.label: Level
level.helpText: The security level of this Identity Provider. Between 1 and 4. 4 meaning that this provider provides the highest security and 1 if this provider provides low security
level.errorMessage: Level is required and needs to be a number from 1-4

formControls.title: Create a new Translation
formControls.help: Add new translation by filling out the form

language.label: Language
language.helpText: The language for this translation (iso key in the select box for this language)

className.label: Class Name
className.helpText: The name of the class (entity/model) that this translation belongs to
className.errorMessage: The class name is required and needs to be in the right format

property.label: Property
property.helpText: The property with in the class that is being translated
property.errorMessage: The property is required and needs to be in the right format

key.label: Key
key.helpText: The key of the item that is being translated
key.errorMessage: The key is required and needs to be in the right format

value.label: Value
value.helpText: The translated text in the selected language
value.errorMessage: The key is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Create new Translation
formControls.help: Add new translation by filling out the form
formControls.conditionalHelp: The item you are creating needs to be saved before creating translations
formControls.errorMessage: Value is required and need to be in the right format

language.label: Language
language.helpText: The language for this translation (iso key in the select box for this language)

value.label: Value
value.helpText: The translated text in the selected language
value.errorMessage: The key is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Create Identity Resource
formControls.help: Identity resources are data like user ID, name, or email address of a user. An identity resource has a unique name, and you can assign arbitrary claim types to it. These claims will then be included in the identity token for the user. The client will use the scope parameter to request access to an identity resource.

name.label: Name
name.helpText: The unique name of the identity resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.
name.errorMessage: Name is required and needs to be in the right format

displayName.label: Display Name
displayName.helpText: The display name value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
displayName.errorMessage: Display name is required and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.helpText: The description value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
description.errorMessage: Description needs to be in the right format

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is enabled.

showInDiscoveryDocument.label: Show In Discovery Document
showInDiscoveryDocument.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is shown in the discovery document.

emphasize.label: Emphasize
emphasize.helpText: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

required.label: Required
required.helpText: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature)

grantToLegalGuardians.label: Grant To Legal Guardians
grantToLegalGuardians.helpText: Should legal guardians automatically get this scope for their wards

grantToProcuringHolders.label: Grant To Procuring Holders
grantToProcuringHolders.helpText: Should procuring holders automatically get this scope for their organisations

allowExplicitDelegationGrant.label: Allow Explicit Delegation Grant
allowExplicitDelegationGrant.helpText: Should identities be able to delegate this scope to other users. Some scopes should not support delegation

automaticDelegationGrant.label: Automatic Delegation Grant
automaticDelegationGrant.helpText: Should this scope always be granted if a user has any other delegation grants. Mostly valid for system scopes. Let's say someone has a delegation grant for the @island.is/bills scope, they should automatically get the profile scope to look up the delegating identity's profile

alsoForDelegatedUser.label: Also For Delegated User
alsoForDelegatedUser.helpText: Should this scope be kept around for the delegated user. Mostly valid for system scopes. When authenticated as a delegating identity, all non-required scopes are removed from the top-level scope array, indicating that the access token can mainly be used to get resources for the delegating identity

formControls.title: Allowed scopes
formControls.help: An API must have at least one scope. Each scope can have different settings.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this scope

noActiveConnections.title: No active scopes
noActiveConnections.helpText: Select a scope and push the Add button to add a scope

formControls.title: Api Resource Secrets
formControls.help: The API secret is used for the introspection endpoint. The API can authenticate with introspection using the API name and secret.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this secret

noActiveConnections.title: No secrets are defined
noActiveConnections.helpText: Add a secret and push the Add button. A random string has been generated for you that you can use if you decide to.

infoModal.headerText: Your secret has been copied to your clipboard. Don't lose it, you won't be able to see it again:

secretValue.label: Api resource Secret
secretValue.helpText: Your secret value should be a rather complicated string

type.label: Type
type.helpText: SharedSecret is the only type supported

formControls.title: Create a new User Claim
formControls.help: Create a new claim if needed for this resource

claimName.label: Claim Name
claimName.helpText: Write a name for the claim. It needs to be one word without special characters
claimName.errorMessage: Claim name is required and needs to be in the right format

type.label: Type
type.helpText: SharedSecret is the only type supported

formControls.title: Select the appropriate user claims
formControls.help: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the access token. The claims specified here will be added to the list of claims specified for the API.

noActiveConnections.title: No User Claims are selected
noActiveConnections.helpText: If necessary, check user the user claims needed

formControls.title: Select the appropriate user claims
formControls.help: If needed, select the user claims for this Api Scope

noActiveConnections.title: No user claims are selected
noActiveConnections.helpText: If necessary, check user the user claims needed

formControls.title: Select the appropriate user claims
formControls.help: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the identity token.

noActiveConnections.title: No user claims are selected
noActiveConnections.helpText: Some claims need to be associated with this Identity Resource

formControls.title: Create Api Scope
formControls.help: Scope is a mechanism in OAuth 2.0 to limit an application's access to a user's account. An application can request one or more scopes, this information is then presented to the user in the consent screen, and the access token issued to the application will be limited to the scopes granted.

name.label: Name
name.helpText: The unique name of the identity resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.
name.errorMessage: Name is required and needs to be in the right format

displayName.label: Display Name
displayName.helpText: The display name value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
displayName.errorMessage: Display name is required and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.helpText: The description value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
description.errorMessage: Description needs to be in the right format

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is enabled.

showInDiscoveryDocument.label: Show In Discovery Document
showInDiscoveryDocument.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is shown in the discovery document.

emphasize.label: Emphasize
emphasize.helpText: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes.

required.label: Required
required.helpText: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature)

grantToLegalGuardians.label: Grant To Legal Guardians
grantToLegalGuardians.helpText: Should legal guardians automatically get this scope for their wards

grantToProcuringHolders.label: Grant To Procuring Holders
grantToProcuringHolders.helpText: Should procuring holders automatically get this scope for their organisations

allowExplicitDelegationGrant.label: Allow Explicit Delegation Grant
allowExplicitDelegationGrant.helpText: Should identities be able to delegate this scope to other users. Some scopes should not support delegation

automaticDelegationGrant.label: Automatic Delegation Grant
automaticDelegationGrant.helpText: Should this scope always be granted if a user has any other delegation grants. Mostly valid for system scopes. Let's say someone has a delegation grant for the @island.is/bills scope, they should automatically get the profile scope to look up the delegating identity's profile

alsoForDelegatedUser.label: Also For Delegated User
alsoForDelegatedUser.helpText: Should this scope be kept around for the delegated user. Mostly valid for system scopes. When authenticated as a delegating identity, all non-required scopes are removed from the top-level scope array, indicating that the access token can mainly be used to get resources for the delegating identity

formControls.title: Create Api Resource
formControls.help: The server hosting the protected resources, and which is capable of accepting and responding to protected resource requests using access tokens.

nationalId.label: National Id
nationalId.helpText: The nationalId (Kennitala) registered for the api-resource-form

contactEmail.label: Contact Email
contactEmail.helpText: Contact email for this Api Resource
contactEmail.errorMessage: Contact email must be set and must be a valid email address

name.label: Name
name.helpText: The unique name of the identity resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.
name.errorMessage: Name is required and needs to be in the right format

displayName.label: Display Name
displayName.helpText: The display name value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
displayName.errorMessage: Display name is required and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.helpText: The description value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
description.errorMessage: Description needs to be in the right format

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is enabled.

showInDiscoveryDocument.label: Show In Discovery Document
showInDiscoveryDocument.helpText: Specifies whether this scope is shown in the discovery document.

formControls.title: Create a new Client
formControls.help: Enter some basic details for this client. Click advanced to configure preferences if default settings need to be changed. You will then go through steps to configure and add additional properties.

selectItems.helpText: You need to select the appropriate Client Type. Information about each type will be shown here when you change the selection.

spa.helpText: A single-page application (spa) doesn't need to reload the page during its use and works within a browser, e.g. Facebook. Since it is running in the users browser, it cannot keep a secret.

native.helpText: A native application is designed specifically for use on a particular platform or device. Since it runs on user´s devices it cannot keep a secret

web.helpText: A web application runs on a web server and is accessed by a web browser. Examples of common web applications are online banking and online retail sales. Is capable of keeping a secret

machine.helpText: An application or service running on a confidential server. This type of application is capable of keeping a secret.

device.helpText: Description for this client type is not present.

nationalId.label: National Id
nationalId.helpText: The nationalId (Kennitala) registered for the api-resource-form

contactEmail.label: Contact Email
contactEmail.helpText: Contact email for this Api Resource
contactEmail.errorMessage: Contact email must be set and must be a valid email address

clientId.label: Client Id
clientId.helpText: The unique identifier for this application. No spaces or special characters.
clientId.errorMessage: The unique identifier for this application. No spaces or special characters.

clientName.label: Display Name
clientName.helpText: Application name that will be seen on consent screens
clientName.errorMessage: Display name is required since the client requires consent and needs to be in the right format

description.label: Description
description.helpText: Application description for use within AdminUI
description.errorMessage: Description needs to be in the right format

baseUrl.label: Base Url
baseUrl.helpText: Base Url of the application. Used for adding Cors Origin, Redirect (callback) URI and Post Logout URI. The Redirect (callback) URI will be the specified Base Url /signin-oidc
baseUrl.errorMessage: Base Url is required and needs to be in the right format

clientUri.label: Display URL
clientUri.helpText: Application URL that will be seen on consent screens
clientUri.errorMessage: Display url needs to be in the right format

enabled.label: Enabled
enabled.helpText: Specifies whether this client is enabled.

requireConsent.label: Require consent
requireConsent.helpText: Specifies whether a consent screen is required

formControls.title: Enter allowed cors origins
formControls.help: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is an HTTP-header based mechanism that allows a server to indicate any other origins (domain, scheme, or port) than its own from which a browser should permit loading of resources.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this cors origin

noActiveConnections.title: No active cors origins
noActiveConnections.helpText: Define a cors origin and push the Add button to add a cors origin

origin.label: Allow cors origin
origin.errorMessage: Cors origin is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Allowed scopes
formControls.help: By default a client has no access to any resources. Specify the allowed resources by adding the corresponding scopes names.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this scope

noActiveConnections.title: No active scopes
noActiveConnections.helpText: Select a scope and push the Add button to add a scope

formControls.title: Select the appropriate grant type
formControls.help: Select the types of authentication that are allowed for this Client

noActiveConnections.title: No grant types are defined
noActiveConnections.helpText: Check the appropriate grant type(s) for the client

formControls.title: Identity provider restrictions
formControls.help: Specifies which external identity providers (IdPs) can be used when authenticating. Note that Sim Card login is always allowed.

all.label: Allow All
all.errorMessage: Claim type is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Enter a post logout redirect URL
formControls.help: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout. See the OIDC Connect Session Management spec for more details.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this post logout uri

noActiveConnections.title: No client post logout redirect uris are defined
noActiveConnections.helpText: Add a post logout uri (if needed) and push the Add button. If a uri exists in the form, it's the display uri defined in the Client form

redirectUri.label: Logout URL
redirectUri.helpText: Users can be returned to this URL after logging out. These protocols rely upon TLS in production
redirectUri.errorMessage: Path is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Enter a callback URL
formControls.help: Specifies the allowed URIs to return tokens or authorization codes to
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this redirect uri

noActiveConnections.title: No client redirect uris (Callback uris) are defined
noActiveConnections.helpText: Add a redirect uri and push the Add button. If a uri exists in the form, it's the display uri defined in the Client form

redirectUri.label: Callback URL
redirectUri.helpText: Full path of the redirect URL. These protocols rely upon TLS in production
redirectUri.errorMessage: Path is required and needs to be in the right format

formControls.title: Add claims for the Client
formControls.help: Allows settings claims for the client (will be included in the access token).
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this post logout uri

noActiveConnections.title: No active claims
noActiveConnections.helpText: Fill out the form and push the Add button to add a claim

type.label: Claim type (key)
type.helpText: The key that represents this claim
type.errorMessage: Claim type is required and needs to be in the right format

value.label: Claim value
value.errorMessage: Value is required and can not contain special characters

formControls.title: Client Secrets
formControls.help: List of Client Secrets - credentials to access the token endpoint.
formControls.conditionalHelp: Your client type doesn't support a Client Secret. You don't need to add anything here.
formControls.removeConfirmation: Are you sure want to delete this secret

noActiveConnections.title: No secrets are defined
noActiveConnections.helpText: Add a secret and push the Add button. A random string has been generated for you that you can use if you decide to.

infoModal.headerText: Your secret has been copied to your clipboard. Don't lose it, you won't be able to see it again:

secretValue.label: Client Secret
secretValue.helpText: Your secret value should be a rather complicated string

type.label: Type
type.helpText: SharedSecret is the only type supported

description.label: Description
description.errorMessage: Description is required and needs to be in the right format
